main event: Pilots of a C-47 aircraft spotted an unidentified bright light near Willow, Alaska on February 17, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a small light and was seen climbing to an altitude of 35,000 feet at an estimated speed of 400 mph.
The pilots tried to track the object with a searchlight but were unable to keep it in sight.
Another C-47 aircraft later spotted a bright red light that appeared to be a circular disk about 40-50 feet in diameter, hovering at an altitude of 1,100-1,200 feet.
The red light then climbed rapidly and accelerated to a tremendous speed before disappearing.
The pilots reported the object's maneuvers were inconsistent with any known aircraft capabilities.
sighted object: Bright light and red circular disk
